description: From translingual Thallophyta. Surface reading of thallus +‎ -phyte (“plant”).

entries.meaning: (botany) Any of very many primitive plants that consist of a thallus (plant body not differentiated into roots, stems and leaves), formerly collected in the obsolete taxonomic group Thallophyta.
examples: They[algae, fungi and mosses] lack the vascular tissues; thus, they are called thallophytes. Algae are thallophytes with chlorophyll. […] Fungi are thallophytes without chlorophyll.
